name: overdecorate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to add too many things, colours, patterns, etc. to an object or place, in an effort to make it more attractive: People often overdecorate their first house, which they only live in for five years on average. Resist the temptation to overdecorate. over-decorated Christmas trees Related words
decorate (MAKE ATTRACTIVE)
overdecoration
More examplesFewer examplesShe tends to overdecorate her home, her office or even herself.You can easily overdecorate such a small room.His home was overdecorated but rather cosy.Don't over-decorate the garden with statues.The cakes were not over-decorated and sugary.
